Basic FAQ items
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Japanese DS Games Archive: Monster Farm DS: Misc. Q&A (post all new topics here, we'll make more sections later): Basic FAQ items
By Lisa Shock on Thursday, July 12, 2007 - 09:19 pm:

Just thought I'd start a thread for basic facts for a beginner's guide.

The stats are listed as:
Life
Power
Intelligence
Skill
Speed
Defense

By GM on Sunday, July 22, 2007 - 10:33 pm:

Monsters can be regenerated by drawing, voice or GameBoy Advance game carts.

Monsters live for 2-3 years at first, but when your The Tree grows, they can live for over four years.

Monsters die in this game.

Stats can't go any higher than 2000.

Monsters can be frozen and saved for later use.

Monsters can be combined to make better baby monsters.

And one new question and answer:

Q: I tried doodle regeneration and got a monster, but it's completely blue. Is something wrong with my game (NOTE: LATTER PART OF QUESTION CAN BE MODIFIED AS NECESSARY)?

A: No, your game is fine. Sometimes when you try regenerating by drawing, you'll get these monsters. They're called pseudo-monsters. There's one for every species, and they're a bit weaker statistically than the pure breed.
